main event: A single orange-colored object was observed in Monrovia, Indiana on 12 July 1956.
interesting points: The object was round and the size of a quarter held at arm's length., The object ascended at high speed, then descended before ascending again., The entire sighting lasted for approximately 30 seconds., The object was heading northwest during the observation., There was a possibility that the object was a balloon or aircraft.
witness description: no report was filed for this incident
